text: this is parkland Florida a city that
will go down in history because of what
happened on February 14 2018 on this day
a gunman opened fire at a local high
school killing 17 people and injuring 17
more one of the survivors is a student
named Jacqueline Koren through her
activism and leadership
she gives me hope that there can be a
safer future for our children and our
communities it began as an ordinary
school day and it was almost over when
gunfire erupted this out this is
essentially our generations Vietnam War
we are all connected through this issue
of gun violence and this time the war is
domestic it's on our streets it's in our
schools
it's at our concert venues and so we're
not gonna stop until we see an end to
this my name is Jacqueline Corrin I'm 18
years old and I'm from parkland Florida
I'm currently the director of outreach
at March for our lives meaning I do
outreach to students all over the
country every single day helping them
with voter registration pushes event
building and outreach once the shooting
happened I needed to speak up and speak
out because we see this happen every
single day in this country whether it be
in school or out of school
gun violence rages our streets and so I
got together with a few of my friends
and we made the March for our lives and
that led to Florida passing the very
first gun safety bill in years and years
and years so that's how I got involved
and a year later I'm still working
[Applause]
I not only do it for the 17 people that
lost their lives in parkland and my
community in my hometown but I also do
it because I've met with so many people
that have experienced similar pain and
I've carried their stories with me and I
want to share their stories because
every single innocent soul that has lost
their lives deserves to have their story
told and their life should continue even
if they're not physically here when I
hear the words I can't just preach it
reminds me of what people said after the
shooting they sent us their thoughts and
prayers as if that was going to change
anything
it wasn't gonna bring back the 17 people
that we lost and I wasn't gonna prevent
any other shootings from happening and
so instead of thoughts and prayers we
have to honor victims of violence with
action grab a friend or find someone in
your community that feels the same way
organized you know maybe hold a town
hall to educate your community about why
this is an issue is important to you or
even just register a few voters because
your vote has power the same the same
way your voice has power I can't sit in
the hope I can't just sit and breathe
you
[Music]
